description:
Add --requires flag to the create command

Usage: tk create "title" --requires approval|review|content

Behavior:
- Set the requires field on the new tick
- Validate value is one of: approval, review, content
- Field persists through tick lifecycle (not cleared on state changes)

Implementation:
- Add -requires and --requires flags to create FlagSet
- Validate enum value before creating tick
- Pass to Tick struct on creation

Examples:
  tk create "Security-sensitive change" --requires approval
  tk create "UI redesign" --requires content
  tk create "API endpoint change" --requires review

Help text should explain that requires declares an approval gate that the agent cannot bypass - even if agent signals COMPLETE, the tick will route to human for the specified review type.
title: Add --requires flag to tk create
